channel.title: Google on juri.strumpflohner
channel.description: Recent content in Google on juri.strumpflohner

item.title: Should Android Worry About the iOS 5 Update? Definitely Not!
item.description: With the announcement of the new iOS 5 at the WWDC, the first articles emerge already on the web relating the new features with the existing Android OS.

item.title: Exercising Our Remote Application Removal Feature
item.description: A friend of mine shared an interesting blog entry from the Android Developer Blog on Buzz. Here some excerpts: Exercising Our Remote Application Removal Feature

item.title: Android 2.2 - Release Froyo
item.description: Take a look at the official video. Some really great enhancements, on the part of the user but also on the developer's part. Personal highlights:

item.title: Google seems to care about privacy
item.description:
I just received the following mail:
Hi, To protect your privacy we would like you to know that Google Latitude is running on your Android-powered device and reporting your location.

item.title: Preview the new Gmail web interface for the iPad in Chrome
item.description: Since the launch of the iPhone and later the Android mobile OS, Google has investigated some time in creating more mobile friendly interfaces of their common web applications (Gmail, GReader, GDocs,Wave), optimized for the advanced touch interfaces.

item.title: Updated Home: Stackoverflow iGoogle Gadgets
item.description: Today my Stackoverflow iGoogle gadgets stopped working. I couldn't identify the problem. I just got the error Unable to retrieve spec for http://files.getdropbox.com/u/10936/gadgetHosting/stackoverflowProfile/prod/stackoverflow.xml. HTTP error 502

item.title: Accessing the host machine from your Android emulator
item.description: I recently started a project where I develop an Android app (there will some posts later on ;) ) which accesses a remote server as its back-end, hosted on the Google Appengine.

item.title: Google Wave...a first comment
item.description: I've now played a bit around with Google Wave for nearly two weeks now and it's quite cool. The real-time collaborative editing is just amazing, as you can also see in the dozen of demonstration videos which are around the web already.

item.title: GWT meets Spring
item.description: GWT is quite evolving recently. There are a couple of reasons for that: Coding apps like Gmail and Google Wave We all appreciate the speed of the Gmail UI.

item.title: New equation editor makes GDocs even more usable!!
item.description: I always liked the idea of having a office-like suite on the web. I already used Writely for taking quick notes or just short documents, already before it was acquired by Google and merged - together with Google Spreadsheets - to the Google Documents service.

item.title: Meta.Stackoverflow, Serverfault and Superuser iGoogle Gadgets submitted!
item.description: After the increasing popularity of Stackoverflow, additional three sites have been added Serverfault.com For system administrators and IT professionals. People who manage and maintain computers in professional capacity.

item.title: iGoogle Gadget: Stackoverflow Profile View
item.description: Are you a member of Stackoverflow.com and you want to track your profile such as your reputation or earned badges? A couple of days ago I've submitted an iGoogle gadget that makes this easy.

item.title: Mashup editor about to shut down
item.description: According to a note on the official Google Mashup Blog, they're about to shut down the Google Mashup Editor product. They took the valuable info they got from a numerous of Mashup developers to develop their AppEngine which will somehow replace the Mashup editor, although it is a different, much more complex product (with more features of course).

item.title: Page Speed: Firebug add-on for analyzing web page speed
item.description: Google just released Page Speed, a Firefox add-on for analyzing web pages in terms of speed. The tool directly integrates into Firebug and automatically verifies your page against a set of best practices rules.

item.title: Image search: Bing vs. Google Image
item.description: Bing does a great job in displaying images. You get all of them displayed in the center of the page within a separate scrollable container.

item.title: QSB - Google Quick Search bar for the Mac
item.description: And voila, the 1st Mac-related post :) Just a quick one, I have to continue with my studies so.. When I switched over to the Mac (2 weeks ago now) I started to get productive as quick as possible (due to my exams).

item.title: Google Wave - Collaboration et excellence
item.description: Some days ago I just quickly scrolled over my Google Reader friends' items and saw Manfred's blog entry about Google Wave. It kept my attention since I didn't yet hear anything about that new Google product.

item.title: Will Microsoft's Bing become Google's biggest threat?
item.description: Microsoft Live Search release wasn't a big success to compete Google on the search engine market. Now they're about to release Bing which is isn't thought to be another "

item.title: Use Google Scholar and Latex for correctly citing papers
item.description: Citing papers is somewhat critical. There are predefined styles that have/should be respected. But it can be really easy. With Latex you can define a kind of "

item.title: Google's newest addition: Google Brain search for mobile!!
item.description: Don't take it too seriously ;) : http://www.google.com/mobile/default/brainsearch.html

item.title: AJAX APIs Playground Ver. 2
item.description: Google announced the version 2 of the AJAX APIs Playground. As you probably know, Google provides you a simple way for managing (especially the versions) the most useful JavaScript libraries such as jQuery, Dojo, Prototype scriptaculus etc.

item.title: Everything you always wanted to know about Google...
item.description: This is a presentation done by a french consulting firm. The slideshow doesn't address technology but goes more into the analysis of the business part, of key business strategies that Google applies on the market.

item.title: Google AJAX APIs: The Google Visualization API
item.description: From now and then I'm always taking a quick look at Google's API page to see whether something new and interesting is there. Today I got stuck at the Google Visualization API, an API that may be especially be interesting for developers involved in web technologies.

item.title: Google contacts and calendar sync
item.description: Google published a new service called Google Sync that allows to integrate the data on Gmail and GCalendar with mobile devices. The steps for activating the synchronization are indicated on the Google Sync page.

item.title: Finally!! Gmail went offline.
item.description: Just a couple of minutes ago, I checked my Gmail account for new lab features (just because of pure annoyance due to the things I've currently to study ;) ) and there was a huge surprise:

item.title: HowTo: synchronize Google Calendar with your iPhone
item.description: I'm sure you already tried this before. Well unfortunately there is no existing, pre-installed way for synchronizing your iPhone calendar with your Google Calendar. What you can do is to sync your Outlook calendars with your iPhone, either when attaching it to your Mac, PC or whatever (having iTunes installed of course :) , Apples strategy as usual) or over the Microsoft Exchange account (if you have one).

item.title: First steps with Silverlight. What about GWT?
item.description: Last week I had some time which allowed me to do some experiments with Microsoft Silverlight. I had to give it a try since you hear so much on the web about it, so I was quite curious, how it works out.

item.title: Building a better query
item.description: Building better Google queries: http://www.google.com/tour/services/query.html

item.title: New Google Personalized page
item.description:
Just got the new release of the iGoogle homepage. Lets see whether there are some improvements :) Links: http://googlesystem.blogspot.com/2008/06/google-tests-new-igoogle.html http://www.google.com/support/bin/answer.py?answer=97658
Update Cool, they reverted my page back to the old iGoogle after 5 days.

item.title: Picasa web albums improved
item.description: Official blog post

item.title: Google Chrome: browsing the Google way
item.description: I just came back from holidays at Rhodos (very nice) and flew over my mails and see there, one notice kept particularly my attention: Google Chrome, a new browser developed by Google.

item.title: Google Earth globe doesn't appear
item.description: Some weeks ago I launched Google Earth to check out a route. For some reason however the globe didn't appear inside the application. All of the pointers, flags and country borders however where there, just the main earth surface was missing.

item.title: Page creator is going to be disposed this year
item.description: Now we know why all the feature requests have not been answered...

item.title: Google about to add offline support to Gmail and GCalendar
item.description: I did already wonder how long it will take for Google to extend their mission of teaching web-apps to work offline on its remaining major services after adding it to Google Reader and Google Docs.

item.title: Lively - Google's answer to Second Live
item.description: Originally I wanted to finish a post I'm currently writing, but then I came across one mentioning Google's newest product. There have already been some rumors about a secret project at Google and now it's out.

item.title: Testing Ajax applications
item.description: Testing the correct functioning of an application is a major issue in software development. Errors happen and cannot (always) be prevented upfront. There are however some approaches to filter bugs already during development

item.title: Gmail awakes attention
item.description: After quite a long time of silence, today the were a lot of rumors regarding Gmail. After adding an initial loading page, they released a "

item.title: Finally, I got Google Docs offline access
item.description: I don't whether you've heared already something about Google Gears? Summarizing shortly it is the possibility of letting modern web ajax applications work offline. Sounds strange to you, letting an "

item.title: Finally, a new GTalk version
item.description: I don't even remember for how long Gtalk hasn't experienced any update. While the Gmail Chat received the capability to be "invisible" and the GTalk Gadget version a "

item.title: Building and hosting applications empowered by the Google infrastructure
item.description: Today I opened Google Reader and immediately a bunch of Google-related headlines jumped into my eyes: "Google Apps Engine". Having already some ideas in mind of what it could be I "

item.title: Improved code browsing on Google Code
item.description: Google Code Hosting changed its way of giving users the possibility to browse code online. Before the plain source file was just displayed on the browser by opening it as a normal text-file.

item.title: Not bad...
item.description: In the last few month Google expanded their street view images to a lot of other cities in the US. Yesterday I just took a quick look, randomly on a street at the bay area of San Francisco.

item.title: Get in contact with your readers
item.description: Google just released an new interesting feature in relation with its instant messaging client(s) (Google Talk, Google Talk Gadget, Gmail Chat). You have now the possibility to place a so-called "

item.title: News Mapper experiences a revival
item.description: After I first published my Google Mashup project "News Mapper", it immediately got published first on the Google Code site of the GME project and then also on the Official GME blog.

item.title: Android - An Open Handset Alliance Project
item.description: There have been a lot of rumors around the web recently about an outcoming "GPhone". Actually there doesn't exist any GPhone, but Google launched a system called Android.

item.title: GME starts to appear here and there
item.description: It seems as if Google uses their new Mashup editor in many other sites for making them more functional in a quick and easy way.

item.title: News Mapper has success!
item.description: My recent News Mapper mashup seems to have some success (at least for me :) ). Today I registered 114 visits which is my personal record for 1 day :D .

item.title: News Mapper: A mashup experience with the Google Mashup Editor
item.description: Now in the two weeks after my successful graduation and before starting to work I found some space for doing some programming experiments. :) What I planned already for a longer time now has been to do some JavaScript coding since it becomes an always more important aspect in modern web technologies such as AJAX and so on.

item.title: Google launched Presentation service
item.description: Google launched the already announced presentation service, directly integrated into Google Docs. I tried it out and created the following presentation: http://docs.google.com/Present?docid=djwjts8_47gkjn9k&fs=true (Official GDocs blog)

item.title: Blogger Buzz: Blogger Play: Watch the blogs go by
item.description: Today Blogger launched a quite nice feature. Well, actually it is not a feature that may be especially useful for Bloggers. They launched Blogger Play.

item.title: GReader a mature product
item.description: Google Reader, Google's News Feed Reader, has become a mature product. Some days ago the Google Reader team released a major update to their product.

item.title: Google Earth 4.2 - Easter egg
item.description: It seems as if Google has integrated an easter egg into Google Earth version 4.2. It is a flight-simulator, not really as the Microsoft Flight Simulator, but a nice and promising start :)

item.title: The final Gmail video
item.description: Remember I wrote a post about a new Gmail advertising campaign some time ago? Look how creative people around the world have been...below there is the final video:

item.title: Google Earth | Sky
item.description: Some time ago I've read (I don't remember where) that NASA will cooperate with Google for integrating their large amount of space pictures and celestial maps into Google Earth.

item.title: Google Talk JavaScript Client
item.description: Today, while scrolling over my Google Reader entries, a headline from the Google Operating System blog (not an official Google blog) got my attention: "

item.title: Creative way of making publicity
item.description: The Gmail team has found another time a way for publicizing their product. Some months ago I've posted a (crazy :) ) video about advertising Gmail.

item.title: Searched a Google Tasklist?? No? Anyway, take a look at this...
item.description: I've seen a lot of people in several online groups claiming that Google should implement some kind of tasklist, possibly integrated with Gmail and Google Calendar.

item.title: GPC team finally replies to user request
item.description: Some time ago I complained about the missing possibility in Google Page Creator to delete a created site. A lot of people complained about it on the official GPC Group without any reaction from the part of the Google Page Creator team.

item.title: Huge update to GDocs interface
item.description: Google has done a huge update to the main Google Docs user interface. One of the major changes was to add support for "folders" which allows for better management of all the different documents.

item.title: Street View on Google Maps
item.description: Google Maps has now a new feature, the "Street View". Street View gives you navigable 360-degree street-level imagery in Google Maps for selected cities. You can see images for a spot and

item.title: One step forward to the "Google Operating System"?
item.description: Yesterday Google released an open source tool called "Google Gears" which allows to run Google Applications offline. According to Aaron Boodman and Erik Arvidsson, two Google Gears Engineers, the ability of running Google web applications offline were one of the major user requests:

item.title: What "sucks" about Google Page Creator
item.description: Google Page Creator has a nice idea: Let people - without any major knowledge in HTML or web design - create and publish easily their own webpage.

item.title: Google presents itself in new style
item.description: Google has done some major changes on its stlye related to the appearance, but also to the way they place the content on the search results.

item.title: We're sorry....but your query looks...
item.description: I'm using the Google Project Hosting service for a university project I'm currently involved in. Recently I got the following error when I wanted to commit my changed code and thought it may be helpful to post it here:

item.title: Google's new presentation service
item.description: Google provides now for already a longer time a service called "Google Docs", giving the possibility of creating text and spreadsheet documents online. The service emerged, when Google acquired former "

item.title: Wondered where your blog-album is??
item.description:
Some time ago on the Blogger blog...
Blogger and Picasa Web Albums Ever wanted to see all the photos you've uploaded to your blog in one place?

item.title: Some kind of crazy
item.description: I just found this video and thought I have to post it…I don’t know what the people at Google do, but somehow they often seem a little crazy :D.
